intro: Geosiris australiensis, commonly known as the Australian geosiris, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, compound leaves and produces yellow or pale green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
